title: Understanding MVC Architecture
content: Model-View-Controller (MVC) is an architectural pattern commonly used for developing user interfaces. It divides the application into three interconnected components

title: Introduction to Sequelize ORM
content: Sequelize is a promise-based Node.js ORM for Postgres, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite, and Microsoft SQL Server. It features solid transaction support, relations, eager and lazy loading, read replication and more

title: Building RESTful APIs with Express.js
content: Express.js, or simply Express, is a back end web application framework for Node.js, released as free and open-source software under the MIT License. It is designed for building web applications and APIs
